funFacts.title: Impressive Egg Production
funFacts.content: Hens produce approximately 250-300 eggs per year, depending on the breed. That's almost one egg per day!

funFacts.title: World's Heaviest Egg
funFacts.content: An ostrich laid the world's heaviest egg at over 2.5 lbs - that's equivalent to about 24 chicken eggs!

funFacts.title: Shell Color Myth
funFacts.content: Egg shell color is breed-dependent and has no impact on nutritional value. Brown eggs and white eggs are equally nutritious!

funFacts.title: Freshness Float Test
funFacts.content: Water flotation indicates egg age. Fresh eggs sink while older ones float due to the air cell inside expanding over time.

funFacts.title: Thick Whites Mean Fresh
funFacts.content: Egg white thickness correlates with freshness. Fresh eggs have thick, firm whites, while older eggs have thinner, more watery whites.

funFacts.title: Impressive Memory
funFacts.content: Chickens can recognize up to 100 faces, including humans! They remember who treats them well.

funFacts.title: Chickens Dream
funFacts.content: Chickens experience REM sleep and can dream, just like humans do. Wonder what they dream about?

funFacts.title: Diet Affects Yolk Color
funFacts.content: Diet quality affects yolk color and richness. Chickens with access to diverse greens and insects produce deeper orange yolks.

funFacts.title: Record-Breaking Hen
funFacts.content: One hen holds the record for laying 371 eggs in a single year. Talk about dedication!

funFacts.title: T-Rex Connection
funFacts.content: Genetic research reveals chickens share closer DNA with Tyrannosaurus rex than modern reptiles do. Your backyard dinosaurs!
